info.name: Public API Development Testing
info.description: All scripts to test the public API.

exec: var assert = require('assert');
pm.test("response must be valid and have a body", function () {
// assert that the status code is 401
pm.response.to.have.status(401);
// assert that the response has a valid JSON body
pm.response.to.be.json;
pm.test("response body must be valid", function () {
// assert that response body is an object
pm.expect(pm.response.json()).to.be.a('object');
// assert that response object have some fields
pm.expect(pm.response.json()).to.have.all.keys('error', 'message');
// assert that error field is a string
pm.expect(pm.response.json().error).to.be.a('string');
// assert that message field is a string
pm.expect(pm.response.json().message).to.be.a('string');
pm.test("response data must be valid", function () {
// assert that error value is valid
pm.expect(pm.response.json().error).to.be.equal('Missing credentials.');
// assert that message value is valid
pm.expect(pm.response.json().message).to.be.equal('Missing credentials.');

item.name: Authentication test with unvalid API keys.

pm.test("response data must be valid", function () {

pm.expect(pm.response.text()).to.be.equal('"Invalid credentials."');
var assert = require('assert');
pm.test("response must be valid and have a body", function () {
// assert that the status code is 200
pm.response.to.be.ok;
// assert that the response has a valid JSON body
pm.response.to.be.json;
pm.test("response body must be valid", function () {
// assert that response body is an object
pm.expect(pm.response.json()).to.be.a('object');
// assert that response object have some fields
pm.expect(pm.response.json()).to.have.all.keys('message');
// assert that message field is a string
pm.expect(pm.response.json().message).to.be.a('string');
pm.test("response data must be valid", function () {
// assert that message value is valid
pm.expect(pm.response.json().message).to.be.equal('Success. Your credentials are valid.');

request.description: API keys are set with headers and are valid. The account is not active.

exec: var assert = require('assert');
pm.test("response must be valid and have a body", function () {
// assert that the status code is 200
pm.response.to.be.ok;
// assert that the response has a valid JSON body
pm.response.to.be.json;
pm.test("response body must be valid", function () {
// assert that response body is an array
pm.expect(pm.response.json()).to.be.a('array');
// asset that response array should contains at least 1 result
pm.expect(pm.response.json()).to.have.lengthOf.at.least(1);
var delivery = pm.response.json()[0];
// assert that delivery item have an id property
pm.expect(delivery).to.have.property('id').that.is.a('number');
// assert that delivery item have a refNumber property
pm.expect(delivery).to.have.property('refNumber').that.is.a('null');
// assert that delivery item have a parcelnumber property
pm.expect(delivery).to.have.property('parcelnumber').that.is.a('string');
// assert that delivery item have a status property
pm.expect(delivery).to.have.property('status').that.is.a('number');
// assert that delivery item have a description property
pm.expect(delivery).to.have.property('description').that.is.a('string');
// assert that delivery item have a shipstart property
pm.expect(delivery).to.have.property('shipstart').that.is.a('string');
// assert that delivery item have a shipend property
pm.expect(delivery).to.have.property('shipend').that.is.a('string');
// assert that delivery item have a pickupcode property
pm.expect(delivery).to.have.property('pickupcode').that.is.a('string');
// assert that delivery item have a deliverycode property
pm.expect(delivery).to.have.property('deliverycode').that.is.a('string');
// assert that delivery item have a distance property
pm.expect(delivery).to.have.property('distance');
// assert that delivery item have a price property
pm.expect(delivery).to.have.property('price');
// assert that delivery item have a vehicules property
pm.expect(delivery).to.have.property('vehicules');
// assert that delivery item have a hash property
pm.expect(delivery).to.have.property('hash');
// assert that delivery item have an origin property
pm.expect(delivery).to.have.property('origin');
// assert that delivery item have a refNumber property
pm.expect(delivery).to.have.property('PartnerId');
// assert that delivery item have a driver property
pm.expect(delivery).to.have.property('driver');
// assert that delivery item have a personAddress property
pm.expect(delivery).to.have.property('personAddress');
// assert that delivery item have a storeAddress property
pm.expect(delivery).to.have.property('storeAddress');
// assert that delivery item have a owner property
pm.expect(delivery).to.have.property('owner');
// assert that delivery item have a receiver property
pm.expect(delivery).to.have.property('receiver');
// assert that delivery item have a contact property
pm.expect(delivery).to.have.property('contact');
pm.test("response data must be valid", function () {
// asset that response array should contains at least 1 result
pm.expect(pm.response.json()).to.have.lengthOf.at.least(1);
var delivery = pm.response.json()[0];

body.raw:
{
  "description": "Bouquet de fleurs à livrer à un de mes clients VIP",
  "shipStart": "2017-12-30 18:28:00",
  "shipEnd": "2017-12-30 20:28:00",
  "dimension": {
    "length": 10,
    "width": 10,
    "height": 20
  },
  "weight": 0.42,
  "Contact": {
    "firstname": "Foo",
    "lastname": "Bar",
    "email": "foo.bar@company.com",
    "mobile": "33642642112",
    "title": "Mr",
    "birthday": 4,
    "birthmonth": 2,
    "birthyear": 1988,
    "Address": {
      "name": "",
      "city": "Paris",
      "country": "France",
      "postalcode": "94270",
      "street": "Rue pasteur",
      "streetnumber": 24,
      "information": ""
    }
  },
  "Customer": {
    "firstname": "Foo",
    "lastname": "Bar",
    "email": "foo.bar@company.com",
    "mobile": "33642642112",
    "title": "Mr",
    "birthday": 4,
    "birthmonth": 2,
    "birthyear": 1988,
    "Address": {
      "name": "",
      "city": "Paris",
      "country": "France",
      "postalcode": "94270",
      "street": "Rue pasteur",
      "streetnumber": 24,
      "information": ""
    }
  }
}
